description: Kuzan intervenes to save Smoker from Doflamingo. The Straw Hats depart Punk Hazard with Law, Caesar, and their new allies, setting course for Dressrosa. Momonosuke enjoys his time with the crew while Kin'emon confronts Zoro about the sword Shusui.

events.title: Kuzan Freezes Doflamingo
events.description: As Doflamingo prepares to kill Smoker, Kuzan suddenly freezes him with his ice powers. Though Doflamingo manages to break free as the ice hadn't reached his heart, he decides not to fight the former Admiral.
events.significance: Demonstrates Kuzan's continued sense of justice despite leaving the Marines, and shows his willingness to protect former colleagues. Also highlights Doflamingo's pragmatic approach to combat.

quotes.text: Even though I'm not enlisted in the Marines anymore, I never fully trusted the World Government and I can still make a difference outside the Marines.
quotes.speaker: Kuzan
quotes.context: Kuzan explaining his motivations to Smoker after saving him from Doflamingo

events.title: Doflamingo Questions Kuzan's Allegiance
events.description: Doflamingo questions what Kuzan stands for now, referencing rumors he has heard about the former Admiral. This foreshadows Kuzan's later association with the Blackbeard Pirates.
events.significance: Plants the seeds for the later revelation of Kuzan's alliance with Blackbeard, creating intrigue about his true motivations and loyalties.

quotes.text: What do you stand for now, Kuzan? I've heard some interesting rumors about you.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo

events.title: Kuzan Explains His Philosophy
events.description: Kuzan reveals to Smoker that although he left the Marines, he never fully trusted the World Government and believes he can still make a difference outside the organization.
events.significance: Provides insight into Kuzan's worldview and sets up his future actions as a free agent working to change the world on his own terms.

events.title: Doflamingo Departs Punk Hazard
events.description: Doflamingo leaves Punk Hazard with Buffalo and Baby 5, choosing to adjust his plans rather than fight Kuzan. He acknowledges that if he can't kill Smoker, he'll need to change his strategy.
events.significance: Marks Doflamingo's departure from the arc and sets up his return to Dressrosa, where the next major confrontation will occur.

events.title: Straw Hats Depart Punk Hazard
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates, along with Law, Caesar Clown, Kin'emon, and Momonosuke, sail away from Punk Hazard on the Thousand Sunny. The departure marks the official end of the Punk Hazard Arc.
events.significance: Concludes the Punk Hazard Arc and transitions the story to the Dressrosa Arc. The alliance between Law and the Straw Hats is now in full effect.

events.title: Momonosuke Bathes with Robin
events.description: Momonosuke takes a bath with Nico Robin, taking full advantage of his child appearance to be close to her. When the male crew members express jealousy, Nami scolds them for 'bullying' a child, which Momonosuke uses to his advantage.
events.significance: Showcases Momonosuke's perverted nature despite his young age, creating comedic moments and establishing his character trait. This is an anime-extended scene.

quotes.text: Thank you for saving me, fair princess!
quotes.speaker: Momonosuke
quotes.context: Momonosuke manipulating Nami into hugging him after she defends him from the others

events.title: Kin'emon Confronts Zoro About Shusui
events.description: Kin'emon sees that Zoro possesses Shusui, a legendary sword and national treasure of Wano Country. He reveals that Shusui was buried with the legendary samurai Ryuma and that the grave was defiled. Kin'emon believes Zoro robbed the grave and nearly challenges him to a duel.
events.significance: Introduces the conflict over Shusui that will eventually lead to Zoro returning it to Wano. Establishes the cultural importance of Shusui to Wano Country and its people.

quotes.text: That sword... That's Ryuma's Shusui! The grave of our greatest samurai was defiled!
quotes.speaker: Kin'emon
quotes.context: Kin'emon recognizing Shusui in Zoro's possession

events.title: Law Reveals the Plan to Attack Dressrosa
events.description: Trafalgar Law reveals the full details of the alliance plan to the Straw Hats. They will use Caesar Clown as leverage to negotiate with Doflamingo at Dressrosa. The true goal is to destroy the SMILE factory to cripple Kaido's army.
events.significance: Sets up the entire Dressrosa Arc and explains the strategic importance of taking down Doflamingo. This reveals the long-term plan to eventually take down Kaido, one of the Four Emperors.

events.title: Dressrosa Revealed as Next Destination
events.description: The crew learns that their next destination is Dressrosa, a kingdom ruled by the Warlord Donquixote Doflamingo. Law explains that they will meet at Green Bit to exchange Caesar Clown.
events.significance: Establishes Dressrosa as the setting for the next major arc and builds anticipation for the confrontation with Doflamingo.

events.title: Breed's First Appearance
events.description: A mysterious figure named Breed appears at the end of the episode, riding on a large sea creature. This is an anime-original character that leads into a filler arc.
events.significance: Introduces Breed, the antagonist of the Caesar Retrieval Arc (anime filler). While not canon, this sets up the immediate next episodes.

quotes.text: Even though I'm not enlisted in the Marines anymore, I never fully trusted the World Government and I can still make a difference outside the Marines.
quotes.speaker: Kuzan
quotes.context: Explaining his philosophy to Smoker after saving him

quotes.text: What do you stand for now, Kuzan? I've heard some interesting rumors about you.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo

quotes.text: That sword... That's Ryuma's Shusui! The grave of our greatest samurai was defiled!
quotes.speaker: Kin'emon

themes.description: Kuzan's departure from the Marines represents a rejection of institutional justice in favor of personal freedom to do what's right. His actions show that one doesn't need to be part of an organization to make a difference.
themes.symbolism: Kuzan saving Smoker despite no longer being a Marine symbolizes that true justice transcends organizational boundaries.

themes.description: The Straw Hat-Heart Pirates alliance solidifies as they depart together toward Dressrosa. The episode emphasizes the importance of trust between crews working toward a common goal.
themes.symbolism: The Thousand Sunny sailing with both crews represents the unity needed to take on greater threats.

themes.description: Kin'emon's reaction to Shusui highlights the importance of cultural treasures and the deep significance of honoring the dead in samurai culture.
themes.symbolism: Shusui represents Wano's cultural heritage and the violation of Ryuma's grave symbolizes the loss of cultural identity.

characterSpotlights.development: Kuzan demonstrates his continued commitment to justice despite leaving the Marines. His philosophy and mysterious future plans are hinted at.
keyActions: Explains his philosophy about justice outside the Marines
References his distrust of the World Government
quotes: Even though I'm not enlisted in the Marines anymore, I never fully trusted the World Government and I can still make a difference outside the Marines.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows pragmatism by choosing not to fight Kuzan. Hints at knowledge of Kuzan's mysterious activities.
keyActions: Gets frozen by Kuzan but breaks free
Departs Punk Hazard with his subordinates
quotes: What do you stand for now, Kuzan? I've heard some interesting rumors about you.

characterSpotlights.development: Takes on a leadership role in explaining the strategic plan to take down Doflamingo and ultimately Kaido.
keyActions: Reveals the full plan to the Straw Hats
Explains the importance of the SMILE factory

characterSpotlights.development: His perverted nature is revealed despite his young age, providing comedic moments while also showing his cleverness in manipulating situations.
keyActions: Takes advantage of his child appearance
quotes: Thank you for saving me, fair princess!

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his devotion to Wano's cultural heritage and his fierce loyalty to his country's treasures.
keyActions: Reveals the importance of Shusui to Wano
Nearly challenges Zoro to a duel
quotes: That sword... That's Ryuma's Shusui! The grave of our greatest samurai was defiled!

mangaDifferences.difference: The Momonosuke bath scenes with Robin and Nami are significantly extended in the anime with additional comedic moments.
Breed's appearance at the end is completely anime-original, setting up a filler arc that doesn't exist in the manga.
Additional scenes of the crew touring the Thousand Sunny and discussing their journey are anime-original padding.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode of the Punk Hazard Arc, which spanned 51 episodes (575-625).
The episode title references a confrontation between Kuzan and Doflamingo, but there is no actual fight - Doflamingo chooses to leave rather than engage.

sources.title: One Piece Episode 625 – Intense! Aokiji vs. Doflamingo

trivia.fact: Breed is an anime-only character who appears at the end of this episode, leading into the Caesar Retrieval filler arc (episodes 626-628).
This episode adapts chapters 698-699 of the manga, marking the end of the Punk Hazard arc in both mediums.

sources.title: Punk Hazard Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode aired with a TV rating of 8.7%, ranking 6th in its timeslot.
The Peto Peto no Mi makes its first appearance in this episode, though it is not named until episode 626.

sources.title: Peto Peto no Mi - One Piece Wiki
